snippet: Total enrollment has not risen, but average class sizes are up and federal and state aid have fallen, a report by the Independent Budget Office said.
abstract: New York City's budget agency reports that city schools are becoming more congested, federal and state aid has dropped, and number of students in 'temporary housing situations,' including homeless shelters, has shot up; says average class size is rising, even as total enrollment has not risen in over decade.
lead_paragraph: Total enrollment has not risen, but average class sizes are up and federal and state aid have fallen, a report by the Independent Budget Office said.

headline.main: Public Schools in New York City Are Poorer and More Crowded, Budget Agency Finds
headline.print_headline: Public Schools in City Are Now Poorer and More Crowded, Budget Agency Finds
